description.narrative:
Reall har ansökt om stöd om £35 miljoner över fem år (2019-2023) för att implementera sin strategiska plan för att bidra till att adressera den globala bostadskrisen. Sida har gjort en bedömning och föreslår ett fyraårigt kärnstöd om totalt 275 msek (2019-2022) för aktiviteter i enlighet med ansökan.
Insatsens mål är att adressera den omfattande globala bristen på adekvata boenden och tillgång till grundläggande samhällsservice i form av vatten och avlopp för människor som lever i fattigdom. Nu bor över en miljard människor i informella bostadsområden och/eller slumområden med bristfällig tillgång till säkert vatten och sanitet.
Reall är en icke-vinstdrivande organisation baserad i Storbritannien som stödjer ett nätverk av lokala organisationer med egna mål om att addressera bostadsbristen för människor i fattigdom.
Insatsens ansats är att genom produktion av lågkostnadsbostäder demonstrera att upplevda och konkreta hinder i sektorn för lågkostnadsbostäder kan överkommas. Intentionen är att påvisade resultat ska attrahera internationella och lokala banker samt professionella byggbolag och därigenom katalysera en större effekt. Bostadsprojekten ska ha utformats för att adressera identifierade hinder för en fungerande marknad av lågkostnadsbostäder och/eller bryta ny mark vad gäller målgrupp, designlösningar, finansieringslösningar eller liknande. Spridning av resultat och aktivt påverkansarbete för policyförändringar samt hållbara finansieringslösningar ämnas göras kontinuerligt.
Produktionen av bostäderna sker av de lokala organisationerna i nätverket och som därigenom får kapacitetsutveckling och finansiering. De lokala organisationerna stödjs för att de ska kunna designa och bygga välplanerade, kostnadsöverkomliga och miljömässigt hållbara hus med hög grad av inkludering av målgruppen eller dess representanter. I brist på andra aktörer tillhandahåller flera av nätverksorganisationerna bolån för de boende. Reall bedriver eget påverkansarbete och stödjer också de lokala organisationerna i detta.
Centralt för insatsen är -att bevisa att fattiga människor kan och vill finansiera sitt eget boende när rätt förutsättningar finns samt -att påvisa att gediget arbete med transparens samt mycket hög nivå av intern styrning och kontroll kan göra byggprocesser förutsägbara och minska risker för korruption. Dessa två områden är avgörande för att attrahera både finansiärer och andra aktörer till marknaden för lågkostnadsbostäder.
Målgruppen är människor med en inkomst som ligger mellan 10-40% på respektive lands inkomstpyramid. Nätverket har nu medlemmar i Zimbabwe, Tanzania, Kenya, Uganda, Angola, Filipinerna, Nepal, Pakistan, Indien, Burkina Faso, Ghana, Sydafrika, Malawi, Nigeria och Mocambique.
Konkreta resultat förväntas vara 4000 nya bostäder, som för målgruppen är adekvata och kostnadsöverkomliga. En ökande andel av dessa förväntas ägas av kvinnor eller gemensamt av en man och en kvinna och en ökande grad av bostäderna förväntas ha anpassats för boende med funktionsvariationer. Bostäderna ämnar bidra direkt till en förbättrad levnadsstandard för 20 000 människor. Som en bieffekt av infrastruktursförbättringar till dessa områden förväntas ytterligare 2000 hushåll få tillgång till säkert vatten och/eller sanitet.
Insatsen förväntas generera minst 6000 direkta- och 48000 indirekta jobb enligt särskilda definitioner.
Under insatsens period förväntas mark köpas för ca 10 000 hus vilket inkluderar förberedelser för påföljande projekt.
I enlighet med förändringsteorin har tidigare period visat på en hög återbetalningsgrad från boende som successivt betalar för sitt eget hus. Återbetalningstiden är anpassad för att få en överkomlig boendekostnad per månad vilket medför att återbetalningar från boende till nätverksorganisationerna och vidare till Reall fortfarande är relativt små, men förväntas öka under avtalsperioden. Under avtalsperioden kan återbetalda medel användas för samma ändamål som nya medel genom att återinvesteras i en ny fas i samma projekt, i ett annat projekt i samma land eller av en annan nätverksorgansiation i ett annat land. Mellan 1 till 3 miljoner pund förväntas återbetalas per år under år 2, 3 och 4 av insatsperioden för att återinvesterats i nya bostäder. Det motsvarar över 25% av Sidas insats under perioden, men utgörs av medel som Reall erhållit under tidigare avtalsperiod.
Insatsen är ett kärnstöd till Reall som efter egna bedömningar ingår avtal med sina nätverksorganisationer om vidareförmedling i olika former eller tekniskt stöd. Organisationerna kommer i sin tur handla upp både varor och tjänster för att anlägga mark och system samt bygga hus. De flesta av organisationerna har intern kapacitet inom samhällsplanering, arkitektur, miljövänlig teknik etc. medan några tar in detta externt.
Cirka hälften av budgeten kommer gå till bostadsproduktion och cirka hälften gå till Realls löpande kostnader, inklusive kvalitetssäkring och påverkansarbete samt vidareförmedling av verksamhetsstöd till nätverksorganisationerna.
För innevarande år bidrar även DFID med ett stöd motsvarande Sidas insats och har en intention att fortsätta i nivå med Sida.

Sida has received an application from Reall for five years (2019-2023) support of £35 million to implement their strategy to address the global deficit of affordable housing. Sida has made an assessment and proposes a 4-year long support (2019-2022), amounting to 275 million SEK. The overarching objective of the intervention is to address the extensive global deficit of affordable and adequate housing and access to basic services such as water and sanitation for people living in poverty. More than one billion people live in informal settlements with substandard access to water and sanitation. By producing affordable houses, the intervention intends to demonstrate that perceived and real obstacles to a functioning sector for affordable housing can be overcome. The intention is that this will attract international and local banks as well as professional building companies and thus catalyse a wider effect. The houses are to be designed to addresses identified blockages to a functioning market for affordable houses and/or bread new grounds in relation to target group, design solutions, financing solutions or other identified needs to systematically address the housing shortage. Dissemination of results and active advocacy efforts to achieve policy development and sustainable financing solutions is to be done continuously. The production of the houses is done by local organisations that are part of Reall's network, through which they receive capacity development support and financing. The local organisations are supported to be able to design and build well planned, affordable and environmentally sustainable houses with a high level of target group participation. Because of lack of other end-user finance alternatives, most of the network organisations provides this service for the target group. Central aspects of the intervention are; -to prove that poor people can and want to finance their own home when the right conditions exist and-to demonstrate that solid work with transparency and a very high level of internal governance and control can make construction processes predictable and reduce the risk of corruption.These two areas are crucial to attract both financiers and other players to the market for low-cost housing.Reall is a non-profit organization based in the UK that supports a network of local organizations. Upon successful assessments, Reall forwards grants to these organisations for functional costs and soft loans for them to build qualitative housing for people with an income between 10-40% on their respective country's income pyramid. The network has presently members in Zimbabwe, Tanzania, Kenya, Uganda, Angola, Philippines, Nepal, Pakistan, India, Burkina Faso, Ghana, South Africa, Malawi, Nigeria and Mozambique.Concrete results expected to be generated include 4,000 new adequate and affordable homes, of which an increasing proportion are owned by women or jointly by a man and a woman, as well as an increasing degree of houses adapted for residents with functional variations. The houses are intended to directly contribute to an improved standard of living for 20,000 people. As a side effect of improved infrastructure to these settings, another 2000 households will have access to safe water and / or sanitation.

Reall's overarching impact objective is to "Disrupt the affordable housing market by attracting investors and commercial property developers, leading up to an additional 100 million affordable homes by 2030". By using the word disrupt, Reall emphasises that the present almost insignificant number of yearly produced affordable houses needs to be completely overthrown. The theory of change is based on the presumption that a rather small number of targeted affordable housing projects that are carried out successfully by Reall and the network partners can be used strategically to prove that investing in affordable housing is possible, sufficiently secure and profitable. This is in turn expected to attract investors and other professional housing developers to the market of affordable housing -which will provide the significant and sustainable contribution towards the long-term objective. The actual houses built by the network is by other words expected to catalyse a large number of houses to be buildt by other actors. The projects are to be appropriate and affordable to the target group, and specifically designed to strategically address the identified challenges and bottlenecks, may it be policy related, end-user finance alternatives or the high real and perceived risks associated to the sector. The proposed output results are: Delivery of homes. Reall will deliver 4000 new affordable homes, benefitting 20 000 people from the bottom 10-40% of the income pyramid. An additional 2000 households will receive improved water and/or sanitation. An increased proportion of the title deeds is expected to be in women’s name or in joint names. An increased proportion of homes is expected to be disability accessible. The baseline is the present situation for homes catalysed through Reall. During the delivery 6000 direct jobs and 48 000 indirect jobs (minimum) are expected to be created. Definitions are presented. During this period, land for estimated 10 000 affordable homes and housing solutions for the target group is expected to be contracted, to also cater for the future project pipeline. Loans that are repaid from the partners to Reall is expected to increase and expected results is that £3 million is reinvested by 2021. The project outputs will be the motor of the work to attain the overarching objective by simultaneously working to build an investment ready network of affordable housing developers and actively disseminate results. This will require the highest level of assurance and control systems, efficient partnerships and demonstration of the effectiveness of the model, example of policy influence and innovations as well as its results. Prove of success of this part is attainment of the objective of securing 25% of the program cost from other investors by 2024. The new phase will therefore have a continued focus on the capacity building of the partners, but with a reinforced emphasis on advocacy efforts. Reall has created a results framework to capture the progress. Though not explicit in the overarching target, Reall's application includes that the homes are to be appropriate as well as affordable. All housing projects must adequately address issues of security (including to tenure rights), safety and the environment. The above mentioned expected results in terms of number of homes, land and water and sanitation services are part of the results area 1: Delivery of more, environmentally sound and sustainable local homes. The results area 2: improved quality of life and household and community resilience, and its specified outputs results aim to capture results on job creation, the number of title deeds in women’s name or joint, accessibility, community design plans that explicitly incorporate security, particularly for women and girls and community environment plans including solid waste, maintenance of communal facilities etc. The results area 3: Increased public and private sector investment and engagement in provision of affordable and sustainable homes aim to capture the work on assurance and control and proving credibility of investments in Reall. The results area 4: Increased knowledge leading to greater engagement by public and private sector in transforming the affordable homes market will capture work on advocacy, evidence and knowledge exchange to influence policies and practise. The work will partly be confirmed by progress in “Ease of Doing business” indicators relating to registering property such as Equal Access to Property Rights Index. Expected global output results from the work of the network in its present 13 countries and potentially new members.

tag.narrative: 11.1 - By 2030, ensure access for all to adequate, safe and affordable housing and basic services and upgrade slums.
11.1 - Senast 2030 säkerställa tillgång för alla till fullgoda, säkra och ekonomiskt överkomliga bostäder och grundläggande tjänster samt rusta upp slumområden.
11.3 - By 2030, enhance inclusive and sustainable urbanization and capacity for participatory, integrated and sustainable human settlement planning and management in all countries.
11.3 - Till 2030 verka för en inkluderande och hållbar urbanisering samt förbättra kapaciteten för deltagandebaserad, integrerad och hållbar planering och förvaltning av bosättningar i alla länder.
11.7 - By 2030, provide universal access to safe, inclusive and accessible, green and public spaces, in particular for women and children, older persons and persons with disabilities.

11.7 - Senast 2030 tillhandahålla universell tillgång till säkra, inkluderande och tillgängliga grönområden och offentliga platser, i synnerhet för kvinnor och barn, äldre personer och personer med funktionsnedsättning.
11.c - Stödja de minst utvecklade länderna, inklusive genom finansiellt och tekniskt bistånd, att bygga hållbara och motståndskraftiga byggnader av lokala material.
11.c - Support least developed countries, including through financial and technical assistance, in building sustainable and resilient buildings utilizing local materials.
6.1 - By 2030, achieve universal and equitable access to safe and affordable drinking water for all.
6.1 - Senast 2030 uppnå allmän och rättvis tillgång till säkert och ekonomiskt överkomligt dricksvatten för alla.

6.2 - By 2030, achieve access to adequate and equitable sanitation and hygiene for all and end open defecation, paying special attention to the needs of women and girls and those in vulnerable situations.

6.2 - Senast 2030 säkerställa att alla har tillgång till fullgod och rättvis sanitet och hygien och att ingen behöver uträtta sina behov utomhus. Särskild uppmärksamhet bör ägnas åt behoven hos kvinnor och flickor samt människor i utsatta situationer.

description.narrative:
Results from the report submitted in June 2020 and presented a range of different results. Among tangible and quantifiable results are:
470 homes built 3975 people with access to energy 8225 people with access to water 3975 jobs created 3612 people with access to sanitation 9,400 US Dollar average cost per housing unit
In addition, Reall has also presented results of their overarching work contributing to a system change in the appropriate and affordable housing space. One example is the launch of a the first affordable housing data dashboard which is informed by Reall's projects. The database can enable and simplify evidence production which in turn is crucial for investors among others to understand the affordable housing market. Other examples are; a project in Philippines that resulted in 15 finalised and "truly affordable homes for teachers on low salaries in urban settings providing them with home ownership opportunities they could never have conceived of previously" which now stands as an example; that the partner i Kenya, NACHU, advanced their negotiations with the Co-operative Bank of Kenya by signing a memorandum of understaning anticipating an agreement on extended loan terms to between 10 and 15 years in length (which substantial will boost the affordability for the end user) plus a lending format that would allow potential customers to be assessed as a group rather than as individual households; and from Pakistan there are progress in access for people on low salaries from formal or informal occupations to access affordable loans form the semi-state-owned Housing Building Finance Company Limited.
There are also a number of policy changes in several countries and while that cannot be attributed to Reall and the partners, it is noted that many of the partners are members of committees and or have been nominated to different roles which have enabled them to have significant influence in different processes.
An unexpected result from Pakistan which demonstrate that investing in poor people is commercially viable is that while landowners previously wanted to sell out land to Reall's partner AMC, there is now interest for joint ventures. This is an opportunity for AMC as it reduces the amount of capital required upfront and builds reputation and credentials in the sector.
Last year, the partner in Nepal managed to negotiate loans to people without formal employments against a guarantee deposit by the organisation in the bank. This year, the partner managed to negotiate a doubling of the number of people that would benefit from the same guarantee which demonstrates that the bank has increased its confidence in the target group.
The number of loans issued to women exceeded the prognosis.
Reall has reported intensive work on climate and environmental aspects and has committed to assure that future projects are EDGE-certified which drives energy efficiency improvements and reduced embodied carbon for construction projects.
While Reall reports work undertaken to secure finance from other sources, there is yet nothing of scale.
In spite of lockdowns in most partner countries, there has been significant progress reported by Reall since the report with the above mentioned results was submitted.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published

strategy.title: Sustainable environment, climate, oceans and use of natural resources 2018-2022
strategy.titleSV: Hållbar miljö, hållbart klimat och hav samt hållbart nyttj. av naturresurser 2018-2022
